metadata.titel_preek: One Exorcism, One Earthquake, One Baptism . . . and Joy

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The reign of the ascended Christ (Easter God) breaking into human history to emancipate the enslaved and transform the hopeless.

subject.identificatie: The Ascended/Easter God (acting through the Name of Jesus)
tekstueel_bewijs: the earthquake was the work of the Easter God
the rule of Jesus let us become our true selves
God’s gift of new spirit into the church to power us
become our true selves, not possessed, not occupied
enact a newness that is an inexplicable gift from God
the one crucified and risen now has all the powers

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify with the Receiver (the one needing freedom).

helper.identificatie: Paul, Silas, and the Church (as conduits of the Name)
tekstueel_bewijs: they stayed free... they prayed and they sang
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Name of Jesus is the instrument of power.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Powers of Enslavement (Pimps, Magistrates, Destructive Spirits, Money)
tekstueel_bewijs: the pimps who used her to make money
official power and angry street power act together to restrain the freedom
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just 'bad habits' but systemic 'killing arrangements' and 'hostile spirits' that require divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer to the gift of freedom (Ethics/Doxology).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Freed Believer (Paul, Silas, Jailer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The 'new obedience' and 'singing' are the result of the primary act of God's emancipation.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Easter God → Emancipation → The Enslaved Hearer
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Name of Jesus → The Easter God ← Systemic Enslavement
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Ascended Christ → Restoring True Selfhood

voorbeelden_god_subject: the rule of Jesus let us become our true selves
the earthquake was the work of the Easter God
God’s gift of new spirit into the church to power us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The jailer reached out for newness
Paul could not bear her critique

voorbeelden: What must I do to be saved?
unless there is a hope and a yearning
Nobody knows how the earthquake came

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God that overcomes human 'Incapacité' (Inability).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Name of Jesus' which acts as the bridge between the prison and the joy.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; enslavement is treated as a real, external, and internal power.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently identifies God/Jesus as the primary actor who achieves what humans cannot. The 'engine' is theocentric.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: He had to decide afresh and unafraid. So do we all.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of the miracle
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the earthquake was the work of the Easter God

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul and Silas are not presented as heroes to imitate, but as witnesses to a power that is also available to the hearer.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God acts, Paul witnesses.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; the burden of 'doing' is replaced by the wonder of 'receiving'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones where God initiates the breakthrough.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are well-integrated; the 'new obedience' is clearly the fruit of the 'Easter power'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'inexplicable gift' and the final call to 'decide'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the one crucified and risen now has all the powers of heaven and earth in obedience

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (power) for the 'new obedience'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a robust grace-oriented narrative. God is the Subject of the transformative verbs, and the hearer is positioned as the beneficiary of a cosmic liberation.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation well.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponents are already cosmic and systemic.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the narrative while making the text deeply relevant to the hearer's existential condition.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'three episodes' structure, Greimas reveals that all three episodes share a single actantial engine: God's power vs. Enslavement.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Philippi; Greimas shows how the text functions as a universal grammar of liberation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Name of Jesus' functions as a 'Helper' that mediates the 'Subject's' (God's) power to the 'Object' (Freedom).

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the trap of making the earthquake a 'metaphor' for human effort, insisting on its divine origin.
